headline: How Tech Firms Are Enforcing AI Use
summary: While many sectors are still experimenting with artificial intelligence, the tech industry has moved to the next phase: tracking their workers’ use of AI tools—and enforcing it if they have to.  This week, Katherine Bindley and Katherine Blunt report on tech companies that are factoring AI use into performance reviews and trying to track productivity gains.  From small startups to giants including  Amazon Alphabet’s  Google and  Meta  tech companies are measuring it and in certain cases factoring it into performance reviews.

raw.headline: How Tech Firms Are Enforcing AI Use
raw.summary: While many sectors are still experimenting with artificial intelligence, the tech industry has moved to the next phase: tracking their workers’ use of AI tools—and enforcing it if they have to.  This week, Katherine Bindley and Katherine Blunt report on tech companies that are factoring AI use into performance reviews and trying to track productivity gains.  From small startups to giants including  Amazon Alphabet’s  Google and  Meta  tech companies are measuring it and in certain cases factoring it into performance reviews.

summary: Meta Platforms (NasdaqGS:META) has agreed multi billion dollar AI chip deals with AMD and Alphabet's Google, expanding its data center hardware pipeline beyond Nvidia. A separate multi billion dollar deal gives Meta access to Google's advanced TPU systems through cloud rentals, adding another major source of AI compute. At...
